summary.p:
The manuscript contains a Tamil syllabary (U2). We find successively:
the series of initial vowels (f1)
the series of the 18 consonants with a vocalisation: ka, ṅa, ca, ña, ṭa, ṇa, ta, na, pa, ma, ya, ra, la, va, ḻa, ḷa, ṟa, and ṉa (f2)
the series of the 18 consonants, given successively (1 folio per consonant), each with the different options for the vocalisation of the consonant and, as final sign, the consonant with puḷḷi (f3–f20)

extent.note: The leaves are broader in their middle than at their edges.

supportDesc.condition: Excellent state of preservation. The leaves are not particularly well prepared.

collation.desc: 20 folios = syllabary. Tamil foliation 1‒20. Later added Arabic foliation 1‒20. 1 line per page (very big letters).
1 folio = guard leaf. Later added Arabic foliation 21.

additions.desc: The manuscript has been used. The original Tamil foliation has been “translated” in Arabic foliation. Furthermore, the same hand has supplied, below the Tamil letters, Latin transcriptions in ink (with indication of the length of the vowels). This was done most probably by/for a French speaker, as shown, e.g., in the ka series (f3r), where ka க kā கா ki கி kī கீ are transcribed as că, cā, quĭ, quī. This later hand also added commas between the individual letters as the alphabet is given in scriptio continua.

origin.origDate: 1835 according to Cabaton (1912, p. 61), on unknown grounds.
